src:
Llegaron desde Salta y Santa Cruz para competir contra las voces de los santiagueños
03 Nov 2019 by La Banda
Entre los finalistas del Torneo Regional de Freestyle, hubo competidores de la ciudad Capital, La Banda, Loreto, Sumampa y Fernández y representantes de Salta y Santa Cruz.
Además, uno de los organizadores, Gabriel Mallesqui del barrio 25 de Mayo, informó que en la oportunidad se organizaron dos competencias porque para el formato original había un cupo de 3 personas porque se realiza con 16. Entonces se desarrolló una competencia previa en la que participaron 32 competidores. Los 3 ganadores se unieron finalmente al grupo de 16 finalistas.
El torneo se realizó en un escenario montado especialmente para la ocasión en la plaza Cultural y Educativa “Mauricio Rojas” y la organización general del evento estuvo a cargo del grupo “Under World” a cargo de Leonardo Gabriel Mayeski y Agustín Nicolás Romano.
Entre los 16 finalistas hubo competidores de ciudad Capital, La Banda, Loreto, Sumampa y Fernández y representantes de Salta y Santa Cruz. La modalidad de la competencia fue uno contra uno, mediante llaves que fueron evaluadas por un jurado conformado por especialistas como Maye, Lea y Cátedra. La musicalización estuvo a cargo del DJ Elías Martínez.l
text:
They arrived from Salta and Santa Cruz to compete against the voices of Santiago
03 Nov 2019 by La Banda
Among the finalists of the Regional Freestyle Tournament, there were competitors from the capital city, La Banda, Loreto, Sumampa and Fernández and representatives from Salta and Santa Cruz.
In addition, one of the organizers, Gabriel Mallesqui of the 25 de Mayo neighborhood, reported that on the occasion two competitions were organized because for the original format there was a quota of 3 people because it is done with 16. Then a previous competition was developed in which 32 competitors participated. The 3 winners finally joined the group of 16 finalists.
The tournament was held on a stage set especially for the occasion in the Cultural and Educational Plaza "Mauricio Rojas" and the general organization of the event was in charge of the group "Under World" by Leonardo Gabriel Mayeski and Agustín Nicolás Romano.
Among the 16 finalists there were competitors from Capital City, La Banda, Loreto, Sumampa and Fernández and representatives from Salta and Santa Cruz. The modality of the competition was one against one, using keys that were evaluated by a jury made up of specialists such as Maye, Lea and Cátedra. The musicalization was in charge of DJ Elías Martínez.l
